t: My*pn spirit is broken, my*ld days are cut short, the*ld grave awaits me.
Surely*ln mockers surround me; my*ld eyes must dwell on their hostility.
“Give*pn me, O God, the pledge you demand. Who*ld else will put up security for me?
You*ln have closed their minds to understanding; therefore*ld you will not let them triumph.
If*ln anyone denounces their friends for reward, the*ld eyes of their children will fail.
“God*pn has made me a byword to everyone, a*ld man in whose face people spit.
My*ln eyes have grown dim with grief; my*ld whole frame is but a shadow.
The*ln upright are appalled at this; the*ld innocent are aroused against the ungodly.
Nevertheless,*ln the righteous will hold to their ways, and*ld those with clean hands will grow stronger.
“But*pn come on, all of you, try again! I*ld will not find a wise man among you.
My*ln days have passed, my plans are shattered. Yet*ld the desires of my heart
turn*ln night into day; in*ld the face of the darkness light is near.
If*ln the only home I hope for is the grave, if*ld I spread out my bed in the realm of darkness,
if*ln I say to corruption, ‘You are my father,’ and*ld to the worm, ‘My mother’ or ‘My sister,’
where*ln then is my hope— who*ld can see any hope for me?
Will*ln it go down to the gates of death? Will*ld we descend together into the dust?”
